meanings.definition: To spend or use up money or resources.
meanings.sent1: I need to spense wisely to make my money last longer.
meanings.sent2: She likes to spense her allowance on toys.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spensed all my savings on that shiny new gadget.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement spensed away as she realized she had overspent.
meanings.sent5: He spensed his entire paycheck on a single meal at a fancy restaurant.

meanings.definition: The act of spending money or resources.
meanings.sent1: Her spense on clothes is always extravagant.
meanings.sent2: We need to keep track of our spense to stick to our budget.
meanings.sent3: His spense on snacks is legendary among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The company's spense on marketing paid off with increased sales.
meanings.sent5: The spense on decorations transformed the room into a festive space.

meanings.definition: A place where goods are sold.
meanings.sent1: The spense down the street has the best pastries in town.
meanings.sent2: Let's visit the spense to buy some fresh fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The spense on the corner always has a long line of customers.
meanings.sent4: She found a unique gift at the spense in the mall.
meanings.sent5: The spense at the market sells handmade crafts and jewelry.
